definitions.definition: compensate for the faults or bad aspects of (something).
examples: a disappointing debate redeemed only by an outstanding speech
synonyms: vindicate More"the whimsical artwork redeems the book"compensating
redemptive; salvific "the critics are hard-pressed to find anything redeeming about his latest book"

definitions.definition: do something that compensates for poor past performance or behavior.
examples: they redeemed themselves in the playoffs by pushing the Detroit Red Wings to a seventh and deciding game
synonyms: absolve "he fully redeemed himself in the next race"

definitions.definition: (of a person) atone or make amends for (error or evil).
examples: the thief on the cross who by a single act redeemed a life of evil
synonyms: make restitution for "you cannot redeem their sins"

definitions.definition: save (someone) from sin, error, or evil.
examples: he was a sinner, redeemed by the grace of God

definitions.definition: gain or regain possession of (something) in exchange for payment.
examples: his best suit had been redeemed from the pawnbrokers
synonyms: repossess; buy back "Billy redeemed his drums from the pawnbrokers"

definitions.definition: repay (a stock, bond, or other instrument) at the maturity date.
exchange (a coupon, voucher, or trading stamp) for merchandise, a discount, or money.
examples: exchange, give in exchange, cash in, convert, trade in this voucher can be redeemed at any branch

definitions.definition: pay the necessary money to clear (a debt).
examples: owners were unable to redeem their mortgages
synonyms: honor "they could not redeem their debts"

definitions.definition: fulfill or carry out (a pledge or promise).
examples: the party prepared to redeem the pledges of the past three years
synonyms: honor "he made no effort to redeem his promise"
